info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 7:12PM MDT by NWS North Platte NE
info.description:
At 712 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Goose Neck Housing to 7 miles west of White Clay to 9 miles southeast of Crawford. Movement was east at 35 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Gordon, Rushville, Hay Springs, White Clay, Clinton, Intersection of Highway 87 and Craven Creek Road, Lone Butte, Irwin, Intersection of Beaver Creek Road and White Clay Creek Road, Intersection of Highway 87 and Larabee Road, Highway 27 crossing the Niobrara River, Smith Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Mount Maria, Intersection of Highway 20 and Irwin Road, Highway 250 crossing the Niobrara River, Walgren Lake State Recreation Area, Shell Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Rock Hill, Bayonne, and Intersection of Highway 27 and Mills Road.
This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 74 and 135. Highway 250 between mile markers 22 and 48. Highway 61 between mile markers 228 and 230.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in North Platte.

parameter.value: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN CHERRY AND SHERIDAN COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM MDT
